intro: Maclaudia felixii, commonly known as the golden star cactus, is a species of cactus native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its cylindrical stem covered in dense, yellowish-green spines. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes.
